DataElement.preferredName: Crack Posterior Tooth Routine Diagnosis Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator of the break or fissure in a tooth towards the back of the mouth (distal to the canines): maxillary and mandibular premolars and molars as routine or common diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the break or fissure in a tooth towards the back of the mouth (distal to the canines): maxillary and mandibular premolars and molars as routine or common diagnosis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A break or fissure in a structure.:Refers to teeth and tissues towards the back of the mouth (distal to the canines): maxillary and mandibular premolars and molars. The designation of permanent posterior teeth in the Universal tooth numbering system include teeth 1 through 5 and 12 through 16 (maxillary), and 17 through 21 and 28 through 32 (mandibular); primary teeth in the Universal tooth numbering system are designated A, B, I, and J (maxillary) and K, L, S, and T (mandibular).

Concepts.definition: A break or fissure in a structure.

Refers to teeth and tissues towards the back of the mouth (distal to the canines): maxillary and mandibular premolars and molars. The designation of permanent posterior teeth in the Universal tooth numbering system include teeth 1 through 5 and 12 through 16 (maxillary), and 17 through 21 and 28 through 32 (mandibular); primary teeth in the Universal tooth numbering system are designated A, B, I, and J (maxillary) and K, L, S, and T (mandibular).

Property.preferredDefinition: An unvarying or habitual method or procedure.:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: An unvarying or habitual method or procedure.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: an indicator of diagnosis for posterior tooth (refers to teeth and tissues towards the back of the mouth).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No apparent change or worsening in lesion staging classification.

Concepts.definition: No apparent change or worsening in lesion staging classification.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept annotation and changed case of Long Name. mc 4/11/17

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
